poem:
"Monster Child on the L-Train"

Child-werewolf sketches life,
a rusted train in the grooves of Chicago, 1968.
Fangs of ink chew on the truth,
Staring at a world kneaded in confusion.
Her seat friend— a phantom of yesteryear: Anka.
Something raw in the metallic lullaby
Of shifting rails and swaying sensations,
The   relentless   reveal    of   unveiling.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My Favorite Thing Is Monsters Book Two by Emil Ferris review – fantastic beasts ‘Drawing is the way I understand things,” says Karen Reyes, as she sits and sketches on Chicago’s L-train, her fanged mouth tight with concentration. It’s 1968 and Karen, a 10-year-old girl who thinks she’s a werewolf, has a lot to digest. The 2017 first volume of My Favorite Thing Is Monsters saw her turn detective after her beloved neighbour, Anka Silverberg, was". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
